channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Registration Open for Summer Intramural Sports
item.description: Date: Thursday, May 23, 2024 - Fri , July 26, 2024 (all day) - RPI Intramural Sports will offer softball, outdoor soccer, volleyball, and 3v3 basketball leagues to all Rensselaer faculty, staff and students for the Summer 2024 semester, with the season set to begin June 3. Games will be held 6-8pm Mondays - Thursdays or noon-5pm Sundays; register with a team or as a free agent!
item.author: Community

item.title: HR Alerts Community to Impact of Upcoming Percipio Administrative Upgrade
item.description: Rensselaer’s Division of Human Resources wishes to alert the campus community that the Percipio online training platform will undergo administrative upgrades from June 10 through June 17, 2024. These upgrades will affect Percipio’s in-progress tracking feature, so any current, in-progress Compliance Module assignments should be completed by June 10; any Compliance Modules that are launched between June 10 and 17 must be completed in their entirety in a single session.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Session to Review Supply Chain, Lean Six Sigma, Systems Engineering
item.description: Date: Wednesday, May 29, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D. as he highlights Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs in areas surrounding Supply Chain and Logistics, Systems Engineering, and Lean Quality. Attendees can expect to learn how these graduate certificates were created in consultation with enterprises that recognize the opportunity and risks of a global supply chain.
item.author: Community

item.title: Farewell Gathering for Father Larry Rice to be Held May 29
item.description: Date: Wednesday, May 29, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - All are welcome to join the Office of the Provost in bidding farewell to Father Larry Rice, who is embarking on a new chapter and extending his support to another community in need after dedicating three years to Rensselaer as its Chaplain. Feel free to stop by the Russell Sage Dining Hall to help honor Father Larry’s contributions and wish him success in his future endeavors!
item.author: Community

item.title: Theo Jean Cuthand Bringing “Indigiqueer” Talk, Screening to EMPAC
item.description: Date: Wednesday, May 29, 2024 7:00 PM - In a co-presentation with iEAR Presents and the EMPAC curatorial program, Theo Jean Cuthand — who makes short experimental videos and films about sexuality, madness, Queer identity, love, and Indigeneity — will give a talk and screening that explores his work and process through an Indigiqueer lens. This event is free and open to the public, and no ticket is required.
item.author: Community

item.title: Summer Outdoor Program Series Kicks Off with Intro to Mountain Biking
item.description: Date: Saturday, June 1, 2024 9:00 AM - 1:00 PM - Arch students are invited to join the Mueller Center’s trip to Gurney Lane for an introduction to mountain biking! Registration is required, and each session has a maximum of ten participants; please contact Emma Atkinson in the Mueller Center to sign up or if you have questions.

item.title: Rotterdam Aquarium Field Trip Scheduled for May 30
item.description: Date: Thursday, May 30, 2024 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM - The School of Science will host an academic field trip to the Rotterdam Aquarium. This opportunity is open to all Arch students; to sign up, please send email to the School of Science.

item.title: Fidelity to Offer Confidential Retirement Consultation by Phone, Zoom Video Option
item.description: Date: Monday, June 3, 2024 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM - Schedule a confidential consultation to help you become better informed and more confident about your workplace retirement savings plan benefits!

item.title: Reminder to Faculty: Update and Publish Summer Term Course Syllabi in HelioCampus
item.description: The Office of the Provost reminds all faculty that they are required to enter and publish their syllabi two weeks after the semester begins; for the summer 2024 semester, that deadline date is June 3. HelioCampus will publish the syllabi automatically on June 10. Those needing help with entering and/or publishing their syllabi can get in-person assistance at 3:00PM on Wednesday, May 29 in Sage 2313; for assistance at other times, contact Amy Svirsky.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Training, Resources to Assist Faculty with Adding Questions to End-of-Term Evaluations
item.description:
Summer II end-of-term course evaluations will be open to students June 17-29, with reports available to instructors on July 26, and instructors who want to add questions to their courses have until June 16 to set them up in HelioCampus. The Office of Undergraduate Education will offer training; resources are also available on the HelioCampus Resource Site.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
